result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Allen Hutton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:44 am cases called-15CM147 & 16CM352. Defendant Larry Allen Hutton in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and read into the record.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:No Contest to 16CM352. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in 15CM147. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: $150.00 plus costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. $615.73 restitution, paid.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
State's Motion to Introduce Statements of Dorothy Paczesny AKA Dorothy R. Hawkins; Forfeiture by Wrongdoing
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Include Other Acts Evidence
Defendant's Motionto Include Other Acts Evidence
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case Called @ 3:00 PM: Defendant Larry Allen Hutton in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  No resolution has been reached. State's for the record that there has been no discussions with defense counsel - matter was placed on the trial calendar with no prior discussions with defense counsel.  No pre-trial filings have been rec'd.  State is willing to proceed with the JT as scheduled with the understanding that information needs to be brought forward quickly to allow for trial preparation.  State does have witness already subpoenaed for trial - some of which are out of State.  Statement by Atty Fenton - information just brought forward from his client prior to going of record.  Atty Fenton unsure if based upon circumstances just brought forward if matter will be ready to be tried on 9/15/2016.  Court notes the date of filing this Complaint - 16 mos attenuated from the filing and counsel in place over the course of those months and now 35 days from JT a defense brought forward that places counsel in a very difficult position for upcoming trial.  Statement by Def as to history of counsel.  Court orders Def: No later than the close of business on Tuesday, 8/16/2016 - statutory guideline to be adhered to as per defense being brought forward by Def.   State will then have 20 days to identify any witness that will rebut the witnesses made available by the Defendant.  JT to go forward as scheduled.  In the Court's judgment, not appropriate to adjourn the JT.  2nd PTC Scheduled ahead of 9/15/2016 JT.  Defendant to execute bond form today and is reminded of the no contact provisions of bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case Called @ 2:58 PM: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Szilagyi appears with Authorization.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.   Per SPD:  Def now residing in Virgiinia and does not plan to return to Wisconsin.  ADA argues as to Bond Conditions as to No Contact provisions.  Per SPD:  Upcoming hearing on a TRO filed in the State of Virginia.  Court orders Bond as requested with no contact provisions.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court holds in abeyance the issue of ID process with WCSD.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 09:45 am.
